business.headline: Will, gift deed or trust: Which is the best way to pass on your wealth?Most families believe a will is enough, but the truth is more complicated. Knowing when to use a will, gift deed or trust can determine whether your wealth transfers smoothly or breaks down in disputes.

How lifestyle inflation, not low income, is hurting your savings? Explains expertMost people blame low income for their poor savings, but financial experts point to something else entirely, i.e., lifestyle inflation. Each upgrade, no matter how small, reduces the space for savings. Is this holding you back too?

Silver hits record high as gold shines. What's the latest bullion rally?The precious metals market is buzzing again as silver hits a fresh record high and gold continues its steady climb. What's fuelling this powerful bullion rally?

Cancer patients in India face health insurance crisis, finds new studyCancer patients are facing a health insurance crisis. A new study finds early detection rising but coverage thinning, leaving households to manage high bills, multiple claims and growing out-of-pocket expenses.

How smart investors maintain liquidity without compromising returnsResearch shows that portfolios with disciplined liquidity management outperform those with static cash holdings during market stress.

From ITR to TDS: 4 key income tax deadlines you can't miss in DecemberWith multiple tax compliances due this month, December demands careful attention from individuals and businesses alike. These four deadlines are the ones you can't afford to miss.

Lenskart share price jumps 5% after Q2 results. Here's all you need to knowLenskart's share price climbed to nearly 5% on the Bombay Stock Exchange around 9:37 am, reflecting renewed investor confidence following one of its best quarterly performances since listing.

Sensex, Nifty scale fresh peaks as Q2 GDP surprise lifts market moodBoth the S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 touched fresh all-time highs in early trade. By 9:24 am, the Sensex was up 309.06 points at 86,015.73, while the Nifty50 rose 84.50 points to 26,287.45.

From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 84: Sanjana faces heat, Divya eliminated The weekend episode delivered a mix of humour and heavy emotions as fun tasks gave way to tough judgments, culminating in Divya Velamuri's emotional exit.

Samantha marries filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in intimate ceremony at Isha Yoga Centre Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre, with the ceremony attended by a small group of guests on Monday.

Bigg Boss 19: Emotional Salman Khan calls Dharmendra's death a huge loss Salman Khan, hosting 'Bigg Boss 19', paid tribute to the late actor Dharmendra, noting the "huge loss" felt by the industry and fans. A visibly emotional Salman added that though difficult, "life goes on."

Laalo is first Gujarati film to cross 100-crore mark globally. See collections Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate has crossed the Rs 100-crore mark at the global box office, and the devotional drama is the biggest Gujarati hit of all time.

Palaash Muchhal makes first public appearance after postponed wedding Palaash Muchhal made his first public appearance at the airport with his mother following a recent health issue and the postponement of his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Zootopia 2 delivers historic $556 million opening weekend at global box office Disney's Zootopia 2 achieved the largest-ever animated film debut, collecting $556 million worldwide in its first five days, with international markets and China playing key roles in its box office success.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 highlights: Aadhirai re-enters house, no elimination this week The Sunday episode of Bigg Boss Tamil 9 saw Aadhirai make a return to the house after her earlier eviction, while host Vijay Sethupathi confirmed there would be no elimination this week.

Kamal Haasan calls casteism his enemy, not actor Vijay or TVK Kamal Haasan clarified that he doesn't view Vijay or his party as a political rival, stressing that casteism, not individuals, is his real opponent. He also spoke about why he won't offer Vijay political advice.

Siddhant Chaturvedi to play filmmaker V Shantaram in upcoming biopic. 1st look out Siddhant Chaturvedi will portray legendary filmmaker V Shantaram in an upcoming biopic. The film highlights Shantaram's pioneering role in Indian cinema and his enduring legacy.

Dhanush, Kriti visit Dagdusheth Temple amid Tere Ishk Mein box office success. Pics Actors Kriti Sanon and Dhanush, along with director Aanand L Rai, visited Pune's Dagdusheth Halwai Ganapati Temple on Sunday as their new film Tere Ishk Mein continues to perform strongly at the box office.

Prehistoric Planet 3 review: Extinction's brutal lesson for humanity's futureRelease Date:Wed Nov 26, 2025 Cave bears smash lion skulls, sabre-toothed cats starve in silence, and ice begins to melt. Five episodes of jaw-dropping beauty later, 'Prehistoric Planet: Ice Age Season 3' leaves you staring at the brutal question about climate change and the future of humanity.

Border 2: Diljit Dosanjh takes flight as fierce IAF officer alongside Sunny Deol Diljit Dosanjh's first look from Border 2 shows him as a fierce Indian Air Force officer, flying a fighter jet in Anurag Singh's high-octane war drama. He is joined by Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty in the film.

How Juhi Chawla handled her 1st on-screen kiss with Sunny Deol in Lootere Producer Suneel Darshan recalled Juhi Chawla's hesitation while filming the kiss scene in the 1993 film Lootere. He added that she completed it in a single take and refused any retakes.

BB 19: Salman Khan, Madhuri's Hum Aapke Hain Koun moment delights fans. Watch Bollywood actors Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit reunited on the set of Bigg Boss 19, recreating a memorable scene from their 1994 film and generating discussion among fans about their on-screen chemistry.

Snobbish elitism: Jaya Bachchan's paps comment draws Ashoke Pandit's sharp retort Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit criticised Jaya Bachchan for her sharp remarks against the paparazzi, calling them elitist and disrespectful. Bachchan's comments in a recent interview reignite debate around celebrity–paparazzi dynamics in Bollywood.

Watch: AR Rahman travels in an auto-rickshaw to visit Nagore Dargah in Tamil Nadu Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman visited Nagore Dargah in Tamil Nadu riding in an auto-rickshaw to participate in the Kanduri festival. The composer performed a few rituals at the Dargah.

Marriage is outdated: Jaya Bachchan doesn't want granddaughter Navya to marry Jaya Bachchan said that she does not want her granddaughter Navya to marry, calling marriage an 'outdated institution'. She also said that she might be getting too old to give her opinion on how women should raise children, because kids these days are getting smarter.

George Clooney says he hated Brad Pitt after losing Thelma & Louise role George Clooney has revealed he narrowly missed out on Brad Pitt's breakout role in Thelma & Louise. In the latest interview, he admitted the loss frustrated him for years before the two eventually became close friends.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar begins limited advance booking in select cinemas With less than a week until its release, Dhurandhar is creating excitement among cinema audiences as advance bookings have started in limited locations. However, worldwide sales are yet to begin.

general news.headline: PM says delivery needed, not drama in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi hits backAfter Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the Opposition to focus on delivery and not drama in the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra hit back, saying raising issues in the House was not drama.

Another BLO dies by suicide, blamed SIR work pressure in heartbreaking videoA video of the BLO from Uttar Pradesh showed the distraught officer breaking down in tears, saying he is unable to finish his SIR job despite working hard.

Video: Renuka Chowdhury brings dog to Parliament, says those who bite are insideIn an unprecedented move, Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury brought her pet dog into the Indian Parliament, stirring widespread debate on parliamentary norms. The incident has sparked discussions on privileges and decorum within the House.

How trade war with poor Afghanistan is bleeding PakistanPakistan's decision to halt trade with Afghanistan, which defence minister Khwaja Asif said was "a blessing in disguise", is backfiring. This is why the ban is hitting Pakistan's own economy hard while the Taliban regime in Afghanistan is finding alternative routes and partners like India.

Samantha marries filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in intimate ceremony at Isha Yoga CentreActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre, with the ceremony attended by a small group of guests on Monday.

Live: Both Houses adjourned till 2 pm amid ruckusParliament Session Live: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking at the start of the Winter Session of Parliament, said the session will contribute to the ongoing efforts to take the nation towards greater progress. He said the world is witnessing both the strength of India's democracy and the resilience of its economy, adding that India has proved that "democracy can deliver." PM Modi urged the Opposition to fulfil its responsibility, stressing that the session is not a ritual but an opportunity to accelerate national development. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates on the Winter Session of the Parliament.

Elon Musk reveals son's name is Sekhar, discloses partner's Indian heritageElon Musk revealed his partner Shivon Zilis has Indian ancestry and one of their sons is named after Nobel laureate Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He also spoke about the role of Indian professionals in the United States.

Supreme Court refuses to extend time to register Waqf properties on Umeed portalThe Supreme Court said applicants can seek case-wise relief from Waqf Tribunals to extend the six-month deadline for uploading Waqf property details on the Umeed portal.

Nandamuri Balakrishna at 65: Last man standing of the genre he shapedWhile most senior stars have moved to sleeker, subtler and more modern formats of storytelling, Nandamuri Balakrishna continues to headline films filled with physics-defying action and unapologetic mass extravagance.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

India orders phone companies to install govt cyber safety app in every phoneThe Indian government has reportedly sent an order privately instructing all major smartphone makers to preload a non-deletable, state-owned cybersecurity application, 'Sanchar Saathi,' on every new device within 90 days.

Can anti-India lawmaker Ilhan Omar be deported from US amid fraud claims?Allegations of marriage and immigration fraud against Ilhan Omar, known for her anti-India stand, have resurfaced again, and a section of American citizens are demanding her denaturalisation and deportation from the US. But is it possible to do so for a naturalised US citizen, who is also an elected Democratic representative?

Marriage is outdated: Jaya Bachchan doesn't want granddaughter Navya to marryJaya Bachchan said that she does not want her granddaughter Navya to marry, calling marriage an 'outdated institution'. She also said that she might be getting too old to give her opinion on how women should raise children, because kids these days are getting smarter.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Next-Gen Kia Seltos teased ahead of December 10 debut. See how it looksKia has released the first teaser of the next-gen Seltos, revealing a fully redesigned SUV with new styling ahead of its December 10 debut.

Mumbai will invoke toughest GRAP-IV if AQI tops 200; Delhi air poor, no new curbsMumbai will impose GRAP-IV restrictions if the AQI tops 200 for three consecutive days. Interestingly, Delhi, battling severe air pollution for over a month, has not seen new curbs despite the AQI consistently going beyond 300 in the past few days.
Why Gen Z is rejecting 'dream jobs' their parents would've killed forFor Gen Z, a job title means less. A life outside work means everything.

Mallikarjun Kharge vs Kiren Rijiju in Rajya Sabha over Jagdeep Dhankhar's exitSloganeering broke out in the Rajya Sabha after Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge mentioned the "unexpected exit" of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar earlier this year, drawing a retort from Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju.

Got zero help from parents: Nikki Haley's son fires back at nepo baby jibesNalin Haley, son of Indian-American Republican leader Nikki Haley, hit back after being called a "nepo baby" and "spoiled brat", insisting he received no parental help. He linked Gen Z unemployment and Democrat Zohran Mamdani's NYC mayoral win to youth frustration, and criticised GOP priorities.

Ex-Indian Navy captain fights strong winds at 20,000 feet for aerial photoAn ex-Indian Navy captain shared a gripping video on Instagram showing the harsh realities of aerial photography at extreme altitudes, and explained what motivated him to keep going.

Border 2: Diljit Dosanjh takes flight as fierce IAF officer alongside Sunny DeolDiljit Dosanjh's first look from Border 2 shows him as a fierce Indian Air Force officer, flying a fighter jet in Anurag Singh's high-octane war drama. He is joined by Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty in the film.

US hit 1.17 million foreign students, a record. But new arrivals fell sharplyThe Open Doors Report 2025 shows that the total international students in the US rose by 4.5% to a record 1,177,766. Yet new international enrolments fell by 7.2% to 277,118. Here's more about this twist.

Ready to give tips on how to perform: PM mocks Opposition ahead of Winter SessionPrime Minister Narendra Modi urged the Opposition to set aside negativity and focus on nation-building. He mocked them for disrupting House proceedings in the past, saying he could give tips on how to perform their official duties.

The Family Man 3 has a scene-stealer twist: Children outshine the star castAmid the chaos of covert ops, it's the family's fractures and healing that strike the deepest in The Family Man 3. While Manoj Bajpayee and Jaideep Ahlawat command the spotlight, it's the children, Atharv and Dhriti, who win the emotional battle.

Samantha marries filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in intimate ceremony at Isha Yoga CentreActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre, with the ceremony attended by a small group of guests on Monday.

Bigg Boss 19: Emotional Salman Khan calls Dharmendra's death a huge lossSalman Khan, hosting 'Bigg Boss 19', paid tribute to the late actor Dharmendra, noting the "huge loss" felt by the industry and fans. A visibly emotional Salman added that though difficult, "life goes on."

sports.headline: Lucas Paqueta slams FA after red card for lack of support in spot-fixing probe Lucas Paqueta condemned the FA's lack of psychological support following his red card against Liverpool. The midfielder, recently cleared of spot-fixing allegations, linked his on-pitch behaviour to the mental toll from the investigation.

IPL 2026: Chinnaswamy games in doubt as government orders safety clearance The Indian Premier League matches in Bengaluru are under cloud with the government ordering safety clearances for the M Chinnaswamy stadium. The move comes after the infamous stampede incident earlier this year.

Praggnanandhaa becomes co-leader at London Chess Classic Open GM Praggnanandhaa and Velimir Ivic share the lead at the London Chess Classic Open 2025 after six rounds. The duo is set to face-off next in the seventh round.

Usman Khawaja doesn't need advice to turn around form slump: Marnus Labuschagne Marnus Labuschagne has backed Usman Khawaja as the Australian opener is currently going through a rough patch of form. Khawaja's position in the team has been questioned after his horrendous run in 2025.

F1 title showdown: How Norris, Verstappen and Piastri can win title in Abu Dhabi The Formula One 2025 season is set for a thrilling climax as Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri battle it out for the crown. Here's how all three drivers can walk away with the crown in the Abu Dhabi GP on December 7.

Don't judge Ruturaj Gaikwad for low scores until you make him open: Aakash Chopra Aakash Chopra has called for giving Ruturaj Gaikwad a chance as an opener before judging his ODI career. The former cricketer also criticised the management for benching Rishabh Pant in the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi.

Without Kohli and Rohit, India had no chance vs South Africa in Ranchi: Kaif Mohammed Kaif has claimed that without the heroics from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, India would have lost the Ranchi ODI against South Africa. Kohli scored a hundred and Rohit hit a fifty as India won the match by 17 runs.

10-man Chelsea frustrate Arsenal, Liverpool end rot vs West Ham Chelsea held Arsenal to a 1-1 draw despite being reduced to ten men. Liverpool defeated West Ham 2-0, with Alexander Isak scoring his first Premier League goal for the club as the Reds ended a difficult stretch of form.

Grew up watching Kohli on TV, bowling to him is fun yet annoying: Marco Jansen South Africa's Marco Jansen reflected on the difficulty and enjoyment of bowling to Virat Kohli after India's 17-run win in the opening ODI. Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred helped India take a 1-0 lead in the series, while Jansen shared candid insights into the challenge of facing the Indian star.

If not for Rana's early wickets, SA would've easily chased 350: Sitanshu Kotak Harshit Rana's early wickets helped India defend 349 against South Africa in Ranchi. He finished the match with figures of 3/65 in ten overs helping India register a 17-run victory.

Indian team least bothered, concerned about SA coach's grovel remark: Kotak India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak says the team is unfazed by South Africa coach, Shukhri Conrad's "grovel" remark after the Ranchi ODI, stressing focus remains on performance.

Without Kohli and Rohit, India had no chance vs South Africa in Ranchi: Kaif Mohammed Kaif has claimed that without the heroics from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, India would have lost the Ranchi ODI against South Africa. Kohli scored a hundred and Rohit hit a fifty as India won the match by 17 runs.

Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred helped India take a 1-0 lead in the series, while Jansen shared candid insights into the challenge of facing the Indian star.

Indian team least bothered, concerned about SA coach's grovel remark: Kotak India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak says the team is unfazed by South Africa coach, Shukhri Conrad's "grovel" remark after the Ranchi ODI, stressing focus remains on performance.

Don't ask any questions, Virat and Rohit have sealed World Cup spots: SrikkanthFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have already sealed their spots for World Cup 2027 and no questions should be asked on their places in the squad for the tournament.

Harsha Bhogle reveals chat with Kohli before question on Test comeback rumoursIndian commentator Harsha Bhogle revealed his conversation with Virat Kohli before asking him about his Test comeback rumours. Despite speculation, Kohli confirmed he will continue playing only ODIs, ruling out a Test comeback.

Max Verstappen wins Qatar GP to ensure three-way title showdown in Abu DhabiMax Verstappen secured his third consecutive win at the Qatar Grand Prix, to push the championship battle into a three-way tussle inAbu Dhabi. Norris's lead was reduced to 12 points following a fourth-place finish, with McLaren's strategy calls under scrutiny.

Inside Kohli's ODI preparations: How India's 37-year-old master keeps dominatingIND vs SA, 1st ODI:  Despite the wealth of experience he carries and his status as an ODI great, Virat Kohli still believes the core of batting lies in the mind. He relies on visualising situations and feeling sharp and switched on, placing greater value on mental clarity than on long, repetitive preparation.

After Rohit Sharma, is Virat transforming his style to push for 2027 World Cup?IND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored a commanding hundred in the first of three ODIs against South Africa. The template of this century was quite different from the ones we have seen Kohli hit in his career.

Virat and Rohit have made oppositions look silly, fun to see them: KL RahulIndia skipper KL Rahul marvelled at how Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can make opposition attacks look "silly", praising the stalwarts after their defining knocks in the first ODI against South Africa on Sunday.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form nowIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

IND vs SA: Aiden Markram proud of Jansen, Bosch's valiant fight in Ranchi thrillerSouth Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed pride in his team's fightback despite a top-order collapse that left them chasing the match in their 17-run defeat to India in the first ODI in Ranchi. After crashing to 11 for 3, spirited innings from Marco Jansen, Matthew Breetzke and Corbin Bosch took the contest into the final over, reinforcing the Proteas' belief ahead of the next match.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form nowIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

After crashing to 11 for 3, spirited innings from Marco Jansen, Matthew Breetzke and Corbin Bosch took the contest into the final over, reinforcing the Proteas' belief ahead of the next match.

India shock Iran 2-1 to seal 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup qualificationIndia's U17 side produced a brilliant comeback to defeat favourites Iran 2–1 in a must-win qualifier in Ahmedabad. The result sealed their spot in the 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup, marking a major milestone for the squad.

India Beats South Africa by 17 Runs in First ODI as Virat Kohli Hits 52nd CenturyOn this Special Report, the focus is on India's victory over South Africa in the first ODI of the three-match series in Ranchi. The speaker highlights Virat Kohli's return to form with his 52nd ODI century, noting it as a crucial performance for the team's confidence ahead of the 2027 World Cup. The report also mentions Kuldeep Yadav's four-wicket haul and Rohit Sharma's half-century as key factors in the 17-run win. The analysis underscores the importance of this victory following a recent Test series defeat.

India vs South Africa: Harshit Rana finds his length in ODIsFast bowler Harshit Rana delivered a fiery opening spell against South Africa in Ranchi, finally offering a glimpse of why the Indian team management has persisted with him in the ODI setup. Playing just his 10th match, Rana bowled with purpose and clarity, justifying the faith invested in his raw pace and temperament.

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIsIND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Virat Kohli special in Ranchi thriller drags India out of week-long Test gloomIndia vs South Africa: Senior batter Virat Kohli lit up a Super Sunday in Ranchi with a sublime 135, his 52nd ODI hundred, as India survived a tense finish to defend 18 runs in the final over and clinch a 17-run win in a last-over thriller.

Steve Smith tests anti-glare eye patches ahead of pink-ball Gabba TestAustralia's Steve Smith was seen using anti-glare eye black during a floodlit training session ahead of the crucial day-night Ashes Test at the Gabba, mirroring Shivnarine Chanderpaul's iconic look. Smith is searching for answers to visibility issues that have affected his pink-ball batting record, with hopes the new approach may offer an edge against England.

Zirkzee, Mount inspire Manchester United's comeback win at Crystal PalaceManchester United came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at Selhurst Park, ending a five-year win drought. The victory boosts United's Premier League standing while raising concerns over Palace's congested schedule.

Shikha Pandey Sold To UP Warriorz For Rs 2.4 Crore In WPL 2026 AuctionIn this exclusive interview, veteran Indian pacer Shikha Pandey opens up about her move to UP Warriorz after being bought for Rs 2.4 crore in the WPL 2026 auction. Speaking to India Today, Pandey admits she was 'anxious' before the bidding but felt 'valued' by the price tag, which was the third-highest in the auction. She reflects on her time with Delhi Capitals, her close bond with former teammate Jemimah Rodrigues, and the origin of her nickname 'Shikipedia'. Pandey also discusses the growing importance of global franchise leagues like the WBBL and The Hundred for players who are not currently in the national team setup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
